title: WisgateOS Global Integration > WisgateOS Global Integration > Connecting a WisGate Edge Gateway with External MQTT Broker > Introduction > Introduction to MQTT and TLS Security
content: MQTT or Message Queuing Telemetry Transport protocol is a machine-to-machine connectivity protocol used in the IoT world. MQTT relies on the TCP (Transmit Control Protocol), which on its own do not allow encrypted communication between the server and the client. To make MQTT more secure, many MQTT brokers (servers) use TLS (Transport Layer Security) instead of plain TCP, which will be tackled in this tutorial.TLS has different modes of working, which represents different levels of encryption.
parent_content: MQTT or Message Queuing Telemetry Transport protocol is a machine-to-machine connectivity protocol used in the IoT world. To make MQTT more secure, many MQTT brokers (servers) use TLS (Transport Layer Security) instead of plain TCP, which will be tackled in this tutorial.TLS has different modes of working, which represents different levels of encryption. For this guide, the **Self-signed server certificate** mode is used.

title: WisgateOS Global Integration > WisgateOS Global Integration > Connecting a WisGate Edge Gateway with External MQTT Broker > Requirements > Prerequisites for MQTT Connection Setup
content:
This is what you will need to prepare before they can make the connection itself:
- **WisGate Edge series gateway running latest WisGateOS version**: It will work on all of the products of this series without any difference.
- **A host to run the MQTT broker on**: The possibility of options here is limitless, but for this tutorial, the Raspberry Pi 4 running Raspberry Pi OS Lite is used.  
> **TIP:** NOTE
